I don't think you are necessarily missing some=
thing. 

My interpretation of your problem is that you're abusing unit test=
ing 
while you should be doing less unit testing and more functional 
testi=
ng. 

Reduce the number of mocks, start working with your real objects.  
T=
his should decrease the test code considerably and reduce the 
potential fo=
r errors (maintaining mock hierarchies can be very 
expensive).  I usually =
recommend to *not* use mocks until you 
actually hit a barrier ( e.g. your =
tests take way too long).  Even 
so, tests that take a long time to run are=
 okay in my book if what 
you are testing actually takes a long time. 

Als=
o, have you taken a look at TestNG? ( http://testng.org) 

It's more geared=
 to functional testing than JUnit is and it might cut 
down on your code as=
 well, thanks to features such as DataProviders 
(data-driven testing) and =
dependent methods...
